text: Erling Wikborg (5 November 1894 - 6 April 1992) was a Norwegian politician for the Christian Democratic Party. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Akershus in 1945, and was re-elected from Oslo on two occasions. Wikborg held a number of other prominent posts. He was the second leader of the Christian Democratic Party from 1951 to 1955, and a member of the Norwegian Nobel Committee in 1965 and from 1967 to 1970. From August to September 1963 he was Minister of Foreign Affairs during the short-lived centre-right Cabinet of John Lyng. A lawyer by profession, he was born in Drammen, graduated with a cand.jur. degree in 1918, and studied international law in France and England in 1922 and 1923. Wikborg died on 6 April 1992 at the age of 97. ==References== * Category:1894 births Category:1992 deaths Category:Members of the Storting Category:Foreign Ministers of Norway Category:Christian Democratic Party (Norway) politicians Category:Politicians from Oslo Category:Norwegian lawyers Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians Category:20th-century lawyers
title: Erling Wikborg
